message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of secure and private distributed matrix multiplication, which involves cryptography, distributed computing, and information theory. Therefore, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), and cs.IT (Information Theory) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel class of secure codes that allow a flexible trade-off between recovery threshold and communication load, which involves optimization and machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the paper also discusses the privacy of the identity of one of the data matrices, which falls under the scope of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
